Begin with a clean base that has been textured using Citadel Astrogranite or similar texture paste. Prime the entire textured base with black spray primer, holding the can 6-8 inches from the surface and using light, even passes. Allow the primer to fully cure for a minimum of 2 hours before proceeding. Black primer serves as an essential shadow foundation for daemon bases, darkening recesses naturally and providing strong contrast for the earth and bone tones to follow.

Using a medium-sized round brush, apply a smooth, even basecoat of Mournfang Brown across all raised texture details and flat areas of the base. Apply 2 thin coats rather than 1 thick coat to avoid obscuring fine texture details. This neutral brown tone provides an excellent earth-like foundation that does not compete with daemon flesh or metallic trim. Allow each coat to fully dry before applying the next.

Using a shade brush or similar applicator, carefully apply Seraphim Sepia wash into all recesses, crevices, and between texture elements. Work methodically to ensure even coverage in shadowed areas without pooling on raised surfaces. Allow the wash to flow by gravity into natural shadow zones rather than forcing it. The sepia wash adds warm tonal depth and unifies varied brown undertones across the base texture. Allow 30-45 minutes for complete drying.

Select a drybrush and load it with Sand Yellow paint. Remove excess paint from the brush by wiping 90% of the paint onto paper towel or cloth. Using light, perpendicular brush strokes, apply the drybrush across raised texture elements, edges, and high points of the base. Focus on areas where natural light would catch the model. The drybrush creates weathering effect and brings out fine detail work previously obscured by washes. Build up in layers rather than a single heavy pass. Seal the completed base with matte varnish once fully dry.

Prime all bone/ivory detail elements (parchment, skulls, horns, bone trim) with black spray primer using controlled passes held 6-8 inches from the model. Black primer ensures sharp definition of fine details and creates strong shadow foundation for bone highlights. Allow full cure time of minimum 2 hours before proceeding.

Using a size 0 or 1 detail brush, carefully apply Wraithbone basecoat to all bone and ivory detail areas. Apply 2-3 thin coats to achieve smooth, opaque coverage that preserves fine detail work. Wraithbone serves as the canonical GW bone colour and provides excellent coverage over black primer. The pale cream tone establishes the aged bone aesthetic consistent with daemon army presentation. Allow each coat to dry fully before applying subsequent layers.

Mix Seraphim Sepia wash with 1 part Lahmian Medium to 2 parts water for controlled application. Using a small shade brush, carefully apply the thinned wash into recesses, beneath horns, and between bone elements. Leave raised areas unshaded to maintain brightness and aged appearance. Sepia wash adds warmth and depth to bone, simulating age and wear. Avoid pooling on flat surfaces by wicking excess with a clean, damp brush. Allow 20-30 minutes drying time.

Using a size 0 detail brush, pick out all raised edges, prominent corners, and highest points of bone elements with Screaming Skull highlight colour. Apply thin, controlled strokes to create crisp edge highlights without overextending beyond physical details. Focus highlights on bone tooth edges, horn ridges, and parchment fold edges. Screaming Skull provides bright contrast to sepia wash while maintaining natural bone appearance. Layer a second coat on the very sharpest edges if additional brightness is desired.

Prime the entire model and lens/glow areas with black spray primer using consistent passes at 6-8 inch distance. Black primer ensures maximum contrast between lens glow and surrounding model features. This is particularly important for daemonic eye effects which should appear to emit light and energy. Allow complete cure time of 2+ hours.

Using a size 0 or 1 detail brush, apply Thousand Sons Blue as the base colour for lens/glow areas. Apply 2 coats for smooth opacity. Keep the coverage within lens boundaries. Maintain brightness in the central areas of the lens by using lighter brush strokes and allowing the black primer to show through slightly at edges. Thousand Sons Blue creates the canonical daemonic eye appearance and provides excellent foundation for glow effect layering.

Apply Coelia Greenshade wash carefully to the outer edges and outer 2/3 of the lens/glow area, leaving the central 1/3 noticeably brighter. Use a size 0 brush and work carefully to concentrate shade along the rim without flooding the entire lens. Coelia Greenshade adds depth and definition to lens shape while maintaining glow effect brightness in the center. The green tint creates an otherworldly, demonic appearance.

Using a very fine detail brush (size 00 or smaller), apply a tiny bright white dot or line at the brightest point of the lens glow, typically at the lower front or center where light would naturally reflect. Apply a second coat of white to enhance brightness if desired. This hotspot highlight creates the critical glow effect and gives the daemon eye dimensional depth. Keep highlight applications tiny and precise - larger applications will destroy the glow appearance.

Prime all horn and claw elements using black spray primer with controlled passes at 6-8 inch distance. Black primer provides strong contrast for horns and claws against skin tones. Allow 2+ hours complete cure time.

Using a small round brush, apply Rakarth Flesh as the base colour for horns and claws. Apply 2 thin coats for smooth, opaque coverage. Rakarth Flesh creates an aged, yellowed bone appearance appropriate for daemon horns and talons. The neutral beige tone bridges between pure bone white and darker shadow areas.

Using a shade brush, apply Agrax Earthshade wash into recesses between horns/claws and along natural shadow lines. Work carefully to avoid excessive pooling on flat surfaces. Agrax Earthshade adds warm brown depth and creates natural shadow definition. The earth-tone wash unifies horn colouring with base scheme. Allow 20-30 minutes drying time.

Using a size 0 detail brush, pick out raised edges and sharp points of horns and claws with Ushabti Bone highlight. Apply thin, controlled edge highlights following the natural geometry of each element. Focus on horn ridges and claw edges where they would naturally catch light. Ushabti Bone provides subtle highlight contrast without appearing garish or unnatural.

Prime all lens/glow elements with black spray primer using smooth, consistent passes at 6-8 inch distance. Black primer creates essential contrast for glowing lens effects. Allow complete cure time of 2+ hours.

Using a size 0 or 1 detail brush, apply Mephiston Red as the glow base colour. Apply 2 thin coats for smooth coverage. Keep brightness higher in the central area of the lens by using lighter coverage at lens edges. Mephiston Red creates bright, energetic glow effect appropriate for daemonic lenses. This base establishes the demonic red glow signature.

Using a size 0 brush, apply Carroburg Crimson wash carefully to outer edges and 2/3 of the lens area, leaving the central 1/3 noticeably brighter to maintain glow effect. Work carefully to avoid excessive pooling on flat lens surfaces. Carroburg Crimson adds depth and definition while preserving glow brightness in the center. The darker red creates dimensional appearance.

Using a very fine detail brush (00 or smaller), apply a tiny bright white highlight dot at the brightest point of the lens glow, typically the lower front or center. Layer a second coat if additional brightness is desired. This hotspot creates the critical glow effect and gives the daemon lens dimensional depth and presence. Keep applications tiny and precise.

Prime all exposed flesh and skin areas using black spray primer with controlled passes at 6-8 inch distance. Black primer provides strong shadow foundation for daemon flesh tones and ensures deep recesses remain visible. Allow 2+ hours complete cure time.

Using a medium round brush, apply Khorne Red basecoat to all exposed daemon flesh areas. Apply 2 thin coats for smooth, opaque coverage. Khorne Red is the canonical GW daemon flesh base colour and creates the classic daemonic red skin tone. Leave thin black lines visible between major flesh sections to maintain definition.

Using a shade brush, apply Carroburg Crimson wash carefully into all recesses, muscle definition lines, and between flesh sections. Work methodically to ensure shade flows by gravity into natural shadow areas. Avoid excessive pooling on large flat flesh surfaces by using controlled brush strokes and wicking excess with a clean, damp brush. Carroburg Crimson adds depth and creates muscle definition essential for daemon appearance. Allow 20-30 minutes drying time.

Using a medium round brush, apply Evil Sunz Scarlet layer to raised flesh areas and raised volumes. Leave shade visible in recesses and between muscles. Apply with controlled strokes, building coverage on raised areas and allowing black primer and shade to show through in shadowed areas. Evil Sunz Scarlet brightens flesh tone while maintaining dimensional appearance. Use a size 0 detail brush to pick out facial features and highest points with bright highlights.

Prime all weapon elements (swords, axes, claws, accursed weapons) using black spray primer with smooth, consistent passes at 6-8 inch distance. Black primer ensures clean, dark base for all daemon weapons. Complete cure time of 2+ hours required.

Using a medium round brush, apply Abaddon Black to all weapon surfaces and casings. Apply 2 thin coats to achieve opaque, deep black coverage. Abaddon Black reinforces prime layer and establishes clean, consistent black base for daemon weapons. This creates intimidating, dark weapon appearance appropriate for daemonic arsenal.

Using a shade brush, apply Nuln Oil wash carefully to all weapon details, crevices, and recesses. Work methodically to ensure shade flows into natural shadow areas and defines details like blade edges, guard decoration, and claw joints. Avoid excessive pooling on large flat surfaces by using controlled application. Nuln Oil adds depth and detail definition to weapons. Allow 20-30 minutes drying time.

Using a size 0 detail brush, apply thin edge highlights along raised edges of weapons, sword edges, claw points, and any ornamental details. Apply controlled, crisp lines that follow the natural geometry of each weapon element. Mechanicus Standard Grey creates subtle contrast that defines weapons without making them appear bright or un-daemonic. Focus highlights on the sharpest edges and most prominent details.

Prime entire model with black spray primer using controlled passes held 6-8 inches from the surface. Black primer provides strong shadow foundation essential for Chaos Knights' imposing armour and creates natural depth in recesses. Allow minimum 2 hours complete cure time before proceeding.

Using a medium round brush, apply Mephiston Red basecoat across all armour panels and raised surfaces. Apply 2 thin coats for smooth, opaque coverage that does not obscure panel detail. Mephiston Red establishes the canonical Chaos Knight red armour appearance - bold and intimidating. Allow each coat to fully dry before applying the next.

Using a shade brush, apply Carroburg Crimson wash carefully into all recesses between armour panels, panel joints, and shadowed areas. Work methodically with controlled brush strokes - allow gravity to guide the wash into natural shadow zones but avoid excessive pooling on flat armour surfaces. Carroburg Crimson adds warmth and depth to the red tone while maintaining the menacing appearance. Allow 30-45 minutes for complete drying.

Re-establish Mephiston Red on all raised armour areas, flat panels, and prominent surfaces. Leave the dark shade visible in recesses and panel joints to maintain dimensional depth. Apply with controlled strokes, building coverage on raised areas while allowing black primer and shade to show through in shadowed areas. This creates the classic red armour appearance with strong contrast.

Using a size 0 detail brush, apply Evil Sunz Scarlet edge highlights along all raised edges, armour ridge lines, and prominent surface details. Apply thin, crisp lines following the natural geometry of each armour element. Focus highlights on the sharpest edges and edges that would naturally catch light. Evil Sunz Scarlet provides bright contrast to the deeper red tones while maintaining the menacing Chaos aesthetic.

Begin with a clean base that has been textured using texture paste (Citadel Astrogranite or similar). Prime the entire textured base with black spray primer using light, even passes held 6-8 inches from the surface. Black primer serves as shadow foundation and provides strong contrast for earth and bone tones. Allow minimum 2 hours complete cure time.

Using a medium round brush, apply smooth, even basecoat of Mournfang Brown across all raised texture details and flat areas. Apply 2 thin coats rather than 1 thick coat to avoid obscuring fine texture detail. This neutral earth brown tone provides excellent foundation that does not compete with red armour or metallic trim. Allow each coat to fully dry before applying next.

Using a shade brush, carefully apply Agrax Earthshade wash into all recesses, crevices, and between texture elements. Work methodically to ensure even coverage in shadowed areas without pooling on raised surfaces. Allow the wash to flow by gravity into natural shadow zones rather than forcing it. Agrax Earthshade adds warm depth and unifies brown undertones. Allow 30-45 minutes for complete drying.

The drybrush creates weathering effect and brings out fine detail work previously obscured by washes. Build up in layers rather than single heavy pass.

Prime all cloth and fabric elements (cloaks, banners, robes) with black spray primer using controlled passes held 6-8 inches from the model. Black primer provides strong shadow foundation for cloth tones and ensures deep recesses remain visible and dramatic. Allow minimum 2 hours complete cure time.

Using a medium round brush, apply Mephiston Red basecoat to all cloth and fabric areas. Apply 2-3 thin coats for opaque, vibrant coverage that maintains fabric detail and folds. Mephiston Red unifies cloth appearance with armour scheme while providing distinct texture contrast. Allow each coat to fully dry before applying next layer.

Using a shade brush, apply Carroburg Crimson wash carefully into all cloth folds, shadows, and valleys. Pin-wash into folds with controlled application - allow gravity to guide the wash into natural shadow areas but avoid excessive pooling on flat cloth surfaces. Carroburg Crimson adds depth and creates fold definition essential for dynamic cloth appearance. Wick excess from flat areas with clean, damp brush. Allow 20-30 minutes drying time.

Re-establish Mephiston Red on upper folds and raised cloth areas. Leave dark shade visible in recesses and fold shadows to maintain dimensional appearance. Apply with controlled strokes, building coverage on upper surfaces and allowing shade to show through in valleys. This creates dramatic lighting effect across cloth.

Using a size 0 detail brush, apply Evil Sunz Scarlet highlights to the uppermost cloth folds and edges where light would naturally strike. Apply thin, controlled strokes following the direction of fabric folds. Focus highlights on the peaks of major folds and sharp cloth edges. Evil Sunz Scarlet provides bright contrast creating dynamic cloth appearance while maintaining Chaos aesthetic.

Prime all detail elements (parchment, skulls, horns, bone trim, spikes) with black spray primer using controlled passes held 6-8 inches from model. Black primer ensures sharp definition of fine details and creates strong shadow foundation for bone and ivory highlights. Allow minimum 2 hours complete cure time.

Using size 0 or 1 detail brush, carefully apply Wraithbone basecoat to all bone and ivory detail areas. Apply 2-3 thin coats to achieve smooth, opaque coverage that preserves fine detail work. Wraithbone is canonical GW bone colour and provides excellent coverage over black primer. Pale cream tone establishes aged bone aesthetic consistent with Chaos Knight presentation. Allow each coat to fully dry before applying subsequent layers.

Using small shade brush, carefully apply thinned wash into recesses, beneath horns, and between bone elements. Leave raised areas unshaded to maintain brightness and aged appearance. Sepia wash adds warmth and depth to bone, simulating age and wear. Avoid pooling on flat surfaces by wicking excess with clean, damp brush. Allow 20-30 minutes drying time.

Using size 0 detail brush, pick out all raised edges, prominent corners, and highest points of bone elements with Screaming Skull highlight colour. Apply thin, controlled strokes to create crisp edge highlights without overextending beyond physical details. Focus highlights on bone edges, horn ridges, and skull features. Screaming Skull provides bright contrast to sepia wash while maintaining natural bone appearance. Layer a second coat on sharpest edges if additional brightness desired.

Prime all metallic elements (weapon trim, armour plating details, ornamental spikes) with black spray primer using smooth, consistent passes at 6-8 inch distance. Black primer ensures maximum depth and definition for metallic surfaces. Allow minimum 2 hours complete cure time.

Using medium round brush, apply Leadbelcher to all metal surfaces and trim. Apply 2 thin coats to achieve smooth, consistent silver/steel base that does not obscure detail work. Leadbelcher provides canonical GW metallic base and ensures good coverage over black primer. Allow each coat to fully dry before proceeding.

Using shade brush, apply Nuln Oil wash carefully to all metallic details, crevices, and recesses. Work methodically to ensure shade flows into natural shadow areas and defines details like edge lines, ornamental patterns, and trim joints. Avoid excessive pooling on large flat surfaces by using controlled application. Nuln Oil adds depth and definition essential for metal appearance. Allow 20-30 minutes drying time.

Re-establish Leadbelcher on raised metal areas and prominent surfaces. Leave dark shade visible in recesses to maintain dimensional appearance. Apply with controlled strokes, building coverage on raised areas and allowing shade to show through in shadowed areas. This creates dimensional metal appearance with natural depth.

Using size 0 detail brush, apply bright edge highlights along all raised edges, ornamental details, and prominent metal surfaces with Stormhost Silver. Apply thin, crisp lines following natural geometry of metal elements. Focus highlights on sharpest edges and areas that would naturally catch light. Stormhost Silver provides bright contrast creating metallic shine while maintaining the dark Chaos Knights aesthetic.

Prime all weapon elements (swords, axes, lances, polearms) using black spray primer with smooth, consistent passes at 6-8 inch distance. Black primer ensures clean, dark base for all Chaos Knight weapons. Complete cure time of 2+ hours required before proceeding.

Using medium round brush, apply Abaddon Black to all weapon bodies, hafts, and casings. Apply 2 thin coats to achieve opaque, deep black coverage. Abaddon Black reinforces prime layer and establishes clean, consistent black base for weapons. This creates intimidating, dark weapon appearance appropriate for Chaos Knight arsenal and maintains menacing aesthetic.

Using shade brush, apply Nuln Oil wash carefully to all weapon details, crevices, and recesses. Work methodically to ensure shade flows into natural shadow areas and defines details like blade edges, weapon decorations, and guard joints. Avoid excessive pooling on large flat surfaces by using controlled application. Nuln Oil adds depth and definition to weapons. Allow 20-30 minutes drying time.

Using size 0 detail brush, apply thin edge highlights along raised edges of weapons, sword blades, lance points, and any ornamental details. Apply controlled, crisp lines that follow natural geometry of each weapon element. Mechanicus Standard Grey creates subtle contrast that defines weapons without making them appear bright or un-daemonic. Focus highlights on sharpest edges and most prominent details.

Prime entire model with black spray primer using controlled passes held 6-8 inches from the surface. Black primer provides essential shadow foundation for grimdark Chaos Space Marine aesthetic and prevents excessive primer buildup. Allow minimum 2 hours complete cure time before proceeding. Black primer alone will serve as the base for the grimdark appearance.

Optional zenithal highlight pass: spray white primer from directly above or steep downward angle at 45 degrees to highlight upper surfaces naturally. Focus white spray on shoulder armor tops, helmet ridges, and raised details while avoiding recesses. This optional step helps visualize lighting direction and provides guidance for future highlight placement. Allow full cure time before proceeding to next step.

Using a medium round brush, apply 2-3 thin coats of Black basecoat across all armour surfaces. Apply thin coats rather than 1 thick coat to maintain texture detail and avoid obscuring panel lines and details. This foundational black layer establishes the grimdark appearance. Ensure even coverage while keeping the surface smooth and matte. Allow each coat to fully dry before applying next layer.

CAUTION: Oblivion Black Wash is thicker and more viscous than standard washes (Nuln Oil). Use carefully to avoid excessive pooling. Apply controlled pin-wash into all recesses, panel joints, and shadowed areas using a small shade brush. Work methodically with light touch - excessive application will create uneven coverage and glossy patches. Wick excess with clean, barely-damp brush. This wash adds depth while remaining within the black tonal range. Allow 20-30 minutes for complete drying.

Re-establish Black basecoat on all upper surfaces, prominent armour areas, and flat panels. Leave dark shade visible in recesses and panel joints to maintain dimensional depth. Apply with controlled strokes, re-establishing pure black on raised areas while allowing shade to remain visible in shadowed zones. This creates the menacing grimdark silhouette while maintaining definition.

Build subtle highlights on upper volumes using Dark Reaper or equivalent dark grey (NOT bright grey). Focus highlights on shoulder armor tops, helmet ridges, and raised panel edges where light naturally catches. Use layered thin highlights to maintain the black reading - multiple thin layers are key to grimdark success. The goal is definition, not brightness. This step bridges between pure black and extreme edge highlights.

Using a size 00 detail brush, apply extremely thin, precise edge lines of Bold Titanium White to ONLY the sharpest raised edges and corner points. Apply tiny crisp strokes following natural geometry of armour panels. Corners receive only tiny pinprick points - do not extend beyond the sharpest geometry. This creates menacing definition while maintaining dark grimdark appearance without appearing cartoonish. Extreme restraint is essential here.

Apply texture paste (Citadel Astrogranite, Vallejo Surface Primer texture, or equivalent) to the base surface using palette knife or old brush. Build varied rough texture to approximately 2-3mm depth with natural undulating surface - avoid perfectly smooth appearance. This creates grimdark grimy foundation. Allow paste to fully cure and dry completely before proceeding - typically 24 hours for best results.

Using a medium round brush, apply smooth, even basecoat of Grey-Blue across all base texture and flat areas. Apply 2 thin coats to achieve consistent coverage without obscuring texture detail. This neutral cool-toned grey provides excellent foundation for grimdark bases that complements dark armour effectively. Keep brush strokes even and avoid over-painting raised texture elements.

Using a shade brush, apply Oblivion Black Wash carefully into all recesses and between texture elements. Work methodically to ensure even coverage in shadowed areas while controlling application to avoid excessive pooling on raised surfaces. Allow wash to flow by gravity into natural shadow zones rather than forcing it. Remember Oblivion Black is thicker than standard washes - use light touch. Allow 30-45 minutes for complete drying.

Select a drybrush and load it with Bright Pale Yellow paint. Remove excess paint by wiping 90% onto paper towel or cloth. Using light, perpendicular brush strokes, apply drybrush across raised texture elements and high points of base. Focus on areas where natural light would catch the model. Build up highlights in multiple thin layers rather than single heavy pass to create weathered, aged appearance. This provides subtle highlight without appearing garish.

Using a small brush, apply clean Black paint around the rim/edge of the base to frame the entire model. Use 2 thin coats if necessary to achieve solid, clean coverage. Ensure rim finish is completely clean with no paint bleeding onto outer base edge. This clean black frame provides professional presentation and frames the grimdark model effectively.

Using a medium round brush, apply clean Black basecoat to all armour surfaces. Apply 2 thin coats for smooth, consistent coverage. Keep the base clean and pure black - this foundation is critical for pure black grimdark aesthetic and will serve as shadow layer. Ensure complete opacity while maintaining thin coat discipline. Allow each coat to fully dry before proceeding.

Using a size 0 detail brush, apply thin edge highlights of Grey along first layer of raised edges. Apply controlled strokes following the natural geometry of armour elements. This mid-tone grey creates dimensional appearance while maintaining dark reading - model still reads as predominantly black. Focus on major panel edges and prominent details. Keep lines crisp but restrained.

Using a size 00 detail brush, apply tiny points of Stone Grey to only the sharpest, most extreme raised edges and corner points. Apply with extreme precision - these are punctuation marks, not continuous lines. Tiny points only on the brightest spots where light would naturally reflect on sharpest geometry. This creates dramatic definition with minimal paint application, maintaining grimdark aesthetic.

Prime all cloth and fabric elements (cloaks, banners, robes, tabards) with black spray primer using controlled passes held 6-8 inches from the model. Black primer provides strong shadow foundation and ensures recesses remain visible and dramatic. Any primer is acceptable but black provides best contrast and prepares surface for grimdark cloth appearance. Allow minimum 2 hours complete cure time.

Using a medium round brush, apply Skeleton Legion basecoat to all cloth and fabric areas. Apply 2-3 thin coats to achieve smooth, opaque coverage that maintains fabric texture and preserves fold definition. Skeleton Legion provides neutral bone/cream tone that complements dark armour while providing desaturated colour appropriate for grimdark aesthetic. Allow each coat to fully dry before proceeding.

Using a shade brush, apply Archaic Sepia Wash carefully into all cloth folds, shadows, and valleys. Pin-wash into folds with controlled application - allow gravity to guide wash into recesses but avoid excessive pooling on flat cloth surfaces. Keep shade application clean and controlled. Archaic Sepia adds warm depth and creates fold definition essential for dynamic cloth appearance. Allow 20-30 minutes drying time.

Re-establish Skeleton Legion on upper folds and raised cloth areas. Leave dark shade visible in recesses and fold shadows to maintain dimensional appearance. Apply with controlled strokes, building coverage on upper surfaces and allowing shade to show through in valleys. This creates dramatic lighting effect across cloth while maintaining muted, desaturated grimdark appearance. Do not over-brighten.

Using a size 0 detail brush, apply thin, precise edge highlights of Bold Titanium White to the very sharpest fold peaks and cloth edges. Apply thin, controlled strokes following the direction of fabric folds. Final fold edges receive this bright highlight to create dramatic lighting. Keep lines crisp and avoid overextending beyond physical cloth geometry. Use restraint - these are accents, not dominant highlights.

Using a size 0 or 1 detail brush, carefully apply Skeleton Legion basecoat to all parchment and bone detail areas (scrolls, skulls, ivory trim, bones). Apply 2-3 thin coats to achieve smooth, opaque coverage. Skeleton Legion provides neutral parchment/bone base colour that works effectively for all ivory details. Allow each coat to fully dry before proceeding to next step.

Using a small shade brush, apply Archaic Sepia Wash carefully into recesses and shadow areas of bone/parchment details. Warm tint adds natural depth to parchment appearance while maintaining aged aesthetic. Wick excess from flat surfaces with clean, barely-damp brush to avoid pooling. Allow 20-30 minutes for complete drying.

Using a size 0 detail brush, apply thin, crisp edge highlights of Bold Titanium White to the sharpest edges of parchment folds and scroll edges. Apply controlled, precise strokes to create definition without appearing garish. Final sharp edges receive this bright highlight. Ensure highlights follow natural fold geometry and remain precise. Medium confidence due to detail work precision required.

If wax seals or red detail elements are present on the model, use a size 0 brush to carefully apply Matt Red basecoat to these areas only. Keep coverage strictly within seal boundaries. Matt Red provides appropriate colour for wax seals and provides vibrant contrast to parchment base. This is a conditional step - only applies if such details exist on the specific model variant.

If wax seals were basecoated in Matt Red, apply tiny dot of Sanguine Scarlet on the brightest point of each seal to simulate wax shine. This is a conditional highlight - only applies if wax seals or similar red details are present on the model. Low confidence due to conditional nature and minimal application required.

Prime all leather and strap elements with black spray primer using controlled passes held 6-8 inches from the model. Black primer provides strong shadow foundation for leather tones and ensures recesses remain visible and dramatic. Any primer is acceptable but black provides best contrast and prepares surface for grimdark weathered leather. Allow minimum 2 hours complete cure time.

Using a small round brush, apply Dark Green Brown basecoat to all leather straps, belts, equipment, and gear areas. Apply 2 thin coats to achieve smooth, opaque coverage. Dark Green Brown provides rich, weathered leather appearance appropriate for grimdark Chaos aesthetic while maintaining desaturated colour scheme. Allow each coat to fully dry before proceeding.

Using a shade brush, apply Battle Mud Wash carefully into all leather recesses, seams, and shadow areas. Work with controlled application to avoid excessive pooling on flat leather surfaces. Battle Mud Wash adds depth and definition while maintaining weathered, aged leather appearance appropriate for grimdark Marines. Allow 20-30 minutes for complete drying.

Using a size 0 detail brush, apply thin edge highlights of Skeleton Legion to raised edges and corners of leather straps and equipment. Apply controlled strokes following the natural geometry of each strap and detail. Focus highlights on worn edges and prominent details to create definition without appearing overly bright. This maintains grimdark aesthetic while providing definition.

Using a size 0 detail brush, apply Matt Red basecoat carefully within the lens shape boundaries. Apply 2 thin coats for smooth coverage. Keep paint strictly within lens boundaries to maintain clean appearance and prevent accidental coverage of surrounding armour. Matt Red provides foundational red tone for lens glow effect. Allow each coat to fully dry before proceeding.

Using a size 0 brush, apply Sanguine Scarlet basecoat carefully within lens boundaries. Keep paint strictly inside lens shape. Sanguine Scarlet brightens the lens and prepares for dimensional appearance through layering. Allow coat to fully dry before proceeding to next step.

Using a size 0 brush, apply Coelia Greenshade wash carefully to the top and back portion of lens area. Work carefully to keep shading on the rear 2/3 of lens, leaving the front/bottom brighter for glow effect. Coelia Greenshade adds depth and definition to lens shape while maintaining brightness in central glow area. Allow 15-20 minutes drying time.

Re-establish Sanguine Scarlet on the lower and front portion of lens area. Leave darker shaded area visible on rear/top to maintain dimensional appearance. Layer with controlled strokes, leaving the brightest area at the front of the lens for glow effect. This creates dimensional lens appearance with strategic bright zone.

Using a size 0 brush, apply Demon Red highlight to the very front and brightest area of the lens. Focus this bright highlight on the lower-front portion of the lens where light would naturally reflect. This brightens the overall glow effect and creates dimensional appearance. Demon Red is highly vibrant - ensures strong glow reading.

Using a very fine detail brush (size 00), apply a tiny, precise dot of Bold Titanium White at the brightest point of the lens, typically the lower-front edge. This tiny dot provides the critical hotspot that makes the lens appear to emit light and energy. Keep application minimal - a single small dot is entirely sufficient. This creates the final glow effect.

Optional second application: if first white dot is too subtle or barely visible, apply a second coat to enhance hotspot brightness. Keep dot application tiny and precise to maintain believable glow effect. High confidence if first application seems insufficient.

Optional gloss varnish step: once entire model is fully dry, carefully apply thin gloss varnish to lens areas only. This enhances lens brightness and creates glossy reflection appearance that simulates glass/energy surface. Keep varnish application minimal to lens areas to avoid creating unintended gloss elsewhere on model. Low confidence due to optional nature.

Optional gloss enhancement: alternatively, apply gloss varnish to create pop effect on lenses if preferred. This optional step enhances the visual prominence of lens glow effects and creates glossy sheen that simulates light reflection. High confidence for optional refinement - purely painter preference.

Prime black for strong shadows and smooth lens/glow area. Use controlled passes held 6-8 inches from the surface. Black primer ensures maximum contrast between lens glow and surrounding model features, essential for lens effects that should appear to emit light and energy. Keep the lens/glow area smooth and free of texture for best glow effect appearance. Allow minimum 2 hours complete cure time.

Base lens + glow area using Matt Red. Keep application tight to lens if you want a pure lens effect without environmental Object Source Lighting (OSL). If desired, feather application slightly outward only if you want an OSL halo effect around the lens showing light source influence on surrounding armour. Apply 2 thin coats for smooth coverage. Medium confidence due to optional feathering decision.

Glaze/shade toward the edges or upper/rear of the lens to deepen tones. Use wash applied carefully with control to establish shape definition. Preserve a brighter hot zone in the center/front of the lens for glow effect. Medium confidence due to glazing/shading control required for precise effect.
Tiny hotspot dot/edge at the brightest point (usually lower-front). For more glow impact
confidence: glaze a thin red halo around the hotspot using thinned Matt Red or similar. Optional: add mid-step using thinned Matt Red + tiny amount White for smoother transition between base and hotspot. Medium confidence due to optional mid-step and feathering decisions.

Apply as thin glaze rather than opaque wash. Carroburg Crimson deepens rear of lens creating 3D appearance. Glaze technique allows base colour to show through while adding tint. This creates dimensional glow that appears to emit light.

Layer Evil Sunz Scarlet on forward and upper lens area using size 0 detail brush. Creates glow progression by brightening toward center-front lens surface. Apply thin layer focusing bright highlight on forward lens face where light would reflect. Evil Sunz Scarlet is vibrant and bright - this creates the critical glow progression. Applying forward/upper creates the illusion that lens emits light toward viewer. This is the visual climax of lens technique.

mix: Tiny dot at lens brightest point
method_notes: Apply infinitesimally small white dot at lens center-front using size 00 brush. This creates critical reflection point making lens appear to glow intensely and emit energy. Apply with extreme restraint - single small dot is entirely sufficient. This is the final glow effect. The white hotspot is the visual trigger that makes lenses read as glowing energy sources. Tiny dot creates believable reflection rather than artificial appearance. This final touch completes the glow effect and brings the model to life.

Prime all metallic areas (non-left-arm) with black spray primer. Black primer provides essential shadow depth for metallic coverage and ensures metallic strength visually. Allow 2 hours complete cure time. Black primer helps metallic paint coverage and establishes shadow layer beneath metallics. Black acts as effective foundation for shiny metallic surfaces.

Basecoat all metallic trim and detail areas with Leadbelcher using medium round brush. Apply 2 thin coats for consistent metallic coverage without obscuring detail. Leadbelcher is the canonical generic metallic for Deathwatch trim (non-left-arm specification). Leadbelcher provides strong durable metallic base. Two thin coats ensure consistent shine and coverage. This is the foundation for all non-gold metallic details.

Wash all metallic areas with Nuln Oil using small shade brush. Pin-wash into crevices and detail lines with controlled application. Add depth and definition to metallic surfaces. Wick excess from raised surfaces. Allow 20-30 minutes for complete drying. Nuln Oil on metallics creates shadow definition and prevents flat appearance. Pin-wash technique focuses shade in appropriate locations. This adds critical depth and realism.

Layer Runefang Steel on raised metallic edges and bright points using size 0 detail brush. Apply crisp thin lines following natural geometry. Creates silvery highlight without making metals appear washed out or unrealistic. This final highlight makes metallics read clearly at tabletop distance. Runefang Steel creates bright metallic shine without appearing cartoonish. This completes the metallic progression and creates visual pop for generic metal details.

method_notes: Wash all weapon areas (both black casings and metallic components) with Nuln Oil using small shade brush. This unified wash creates cohesive appearance and adds depth to entire weapon. Pin-wash into recesses with controlled application. Allow 30-45 minutes for complete drying. Single unified wash ties all weapon elements together visually. Nuln Oil works on both black and metal creating harmonious result. This step dramatically improves weapon realism and definition.

Apply thin edge highlights of Eshin Grey to weapon edges and raised details using size 0 detail brush. Keep subtle - weapons remain predominantly dark and lethal-looking. Apply crisp lines following natural weapon geometry. This maintains grimdark aesthetic while providing definition.
